Articles.Content:
With the gfx settings set to max I still have extremely low texture quality whilst in build and flight mode.

I am using the 32bit version with no mods.

Edited October 8, 2014 by sysigy
Noticed that as well, It's easy to notice on the largest stack decoupler and the Largest Kerbodyne tanks.
Me too. Parts are blurry, scenery is sharp.

Change your settings to whatever you desire then completely exit and restart the game. I had the same issue ... I think the textures are only loaded on startup. If this resolves your issue, please edit the post prefix to indicate as such.

Edited October 8, 2014 by Caelib

Had this as well. I figured out that changing the settings and re-applying them fixed it. So I went and deleted settings.cfg just to be sure, and set up everything again. According to the Economic Boom FAQ, there's some known issue with old settings files.
You just need to go into graphics and set anti aliasing to 8x or more of fixed it for me.

So I tried the suggestions in the above posts but nothing worked.

I deleted my entire KSP_Win folder and re-extracted from the .zip file. I set my gfx settings from the launcher this time before I started the game. When I launched and played the textures are now super sharp.
I've tried all of the solutions above... Guess I'll try to ust delete the whole game and re-download it with Steam again. Maybe that'll fix it.
Your old settings flies where overridden and replaced with the default settings... So just turn the settings back up again.
The problem is, changing settings, or deleting the whole settings.cfg file does nothing. At least in my case.
